title: U.S. disposable personal income - monthly percentage of change 2019/20
summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Monthly percentage of change for 13 number of Months.
The maximum Monthly percentage of change 0.6 is found at Month Jan '20 and the minimum is found at Oct '19 where Month is 0.0.
There is a difference of 0.6 between the maximum Month Jan '20 and minimum Month Oct '19.
min_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Monthly percentage of change for 13 number of Months.

max_summary: This bar chart has 13 columns on the x axis representing Month, and Monthly percentage of change in each Month on the y axis.
The Monthly percentage of change is highest at Month Jan '20 and lowest at Month Oct '19.
The second highest Monthly percentage of change is appeared to be the Month Aug '19.
There is a difference of 0.6 between the maximum Month Jan '20 and minimum Month Oct '19.
Monthly percentage of change at Month Jan '20 is 0.6 , second place is Aug '19 at 0.6, and thirdly is Feb '19 at 0.5.
Overall Monthly percentage of change has declined over the Months.
Month Nov '19, Jun '19, Apr '19, and Mar '19 have a similar Monthly percentage of change that is 0.4.
The Month Oct '19 has 1.73 times less Monthly percentage of change than average.
